name: Telephone Account Manager
summary: Design and implement account strategies for growing existing accounts and acquires new business from prospective partners.
description:
About the Role
At LV= General Insurance (LV= GI), we go above and beyond to help our millions of customers look after what they love. Putting our people first, and our customer at the heart of everything we do, we’ve made it our mission to become Britain’s best-loved insurer.
Having joined the Allianz family, we’re proud to be one of the largest personal insurers in the UK.
Our purpose is ‘We secure your future’ for our employees, our customers and the wider society. This sits at the heart of our business.
About Your Opportunity
LV=GI have a fantastic opportunity for a Telephone Account Manager to join the LV Broker Distribution team. You will be working within an agile team as a homebased employee.
The Telephone Account Manager will provide account management and the development of a panel of business partners, promoting the LV=GI products and proposition by building and maintain strong business relationships with the relevant managers in the partner organisations (existing and new) to ensure alignment of goals and delivery against plans
Your Focus:

Develops and maintains high-level management relationships with the senior personnel within the account base to deliver profit and growth in line with the Corporate Plan targets. Creates accounts plans and manages performance against plan, taking corrective actions where required. 
Design and implement account strategies for growing existing accounts and acquires new business from prospective partners. 
Provides regular reporting, feedback and market intelligence, as required by the company, within agreed guidelines and format. Provides market and competitor information as and when required 
Develops, communicates and implements the individual broker and/or panel plans to deliver in line with the Corporate Plan targets. Engages supporting teams regularly to maintain focus. 
Develops strong relationships with the partnership(s) (existing and new customers) and key personnel to fully understand their business, trading models and organisation structure in order to negotiate strong commercial outcome and facilitate appropriate internal stakeholder engagement. 

What We're Looking For
You will have previous experience in business to business relationship/account management, and experience managing or participating in high level relationships. A background in General Insurance and/or Broking is desirable.
You will have experience of working with cross-functional teams to achieve customer profitable growth objective with the ability to develop and implement customer strategies
You will have excellent written and verbal communication skills with the ability to explain complex or technical information in a simple way. You will enjoy problem solving, and when required, have the ability to influence and negotiate to achieve great outcomes.
You will have excellent planning, organisational skills and the ability to produce, understand and interpret statistical information. You will have the ability to deliver accurate work under pressure against agreed deadlines with.
You will have knowledge of FCA Regulation and Broker governance procedures
Ways of Working
We are delighted to confirm that we are now a hybrid working business. As a Telephone Account Manager, you will be working within an agile team as a homebased employee.
About the Rewards
We want you to love what you do that’s why we’ve put together a benefits package that recognises and rewards a job well done.
We’ll give you:

Flexible working opportunities – many of our employees job share or work part-time, flexi-time, or compressed hours. Our new hybrid working model now offers all employees the option to work from home 3 days a week and 2 days in the office. 
26 days' holiday – which increases after two years’ service to 28 days 
A competitive pension for which LV= will pay twice the amount you pay, up to 14% (please click here to read more about it) 
An annual bonus scheme based on company and personal performance 
A flexible benefits package (e.g. discounted retail vouchers, great value dental insurance) 
A generous 25% discount off our general insurance products including home, pet and travel as well as up to 50% discount on your car insurance. 

To find out more about our benefits and rewards, please click here.
Our Values
Our company values drive everything we do - and they are:
Be Brave | With Heart | Everyone Counts | Inspiring Trust
LV= is an equal opportunities employer who values a diverse and inclusive workplace. We recognise that people work in different ways, and we value alternative viewpoints, celebrate individuality and foster a culture where everyone can bring their true self to work. We are committed to creating a diverse workforce, we accept applications from everyone regardless of your background, beliefs, culture, gender identity, ethnicity, sexual orientation, disabilities and long-term health conditions.
Here at LV= we always love to hear from great people, so don’t forget to follow us on Instagram, Twitter, LinkedIn and become a fan on Facebook.

Your mission

Get the unique chance to be in our team as Account Manager for the leading German Amazon Agency. As an Amazon Account Manager (m/f/d) you will be working closely on the success of your assigned customers, their products, and brand(s). You are responsible for the sustainable and long-term performance of the customer, develop clients’ accounts strategically (Seller or Vendor) and are the main contact person for the customer. You will also coordinate tasks with other teams from advertising, visual branding and content. We give you the opportunity to build and implement structures and processes for our account management team in UK.
    

Your tasks:


 Development of marketplace and product strategies on Amazon
 Strategic and operational planning for enterprise customers 
Consulting of enterprise customers in terms of relevant key performance indicators
 Analysis of the product and sales performance of customers
 Creation of account reports for customers 
Administration and maintenance of customer accounts on Amazon 
Creation, optimization and maintenance of product detail pages with relevant content
 Monitoring and optimization of product rankings and keywords
 Coordination of all interactions between Marketplace Team, Advertising Team and Content Team
 Set up and further development of business processes




Your profile


Completed studies (Bachelor or Master) in the field of business administration, economics, cultural studies or similar
 Professional experience in the field of (online) marketing
 Professional experience in the Amazon ecosystem
 Very good theoretical knowledge in the field of marketing and sales
 Willingness to take responsibility and to constantly develop further 
Strong ability to work in a team, which is based both in the UK and DE
 Engaging strong communication skills
 Outstanding intercultural skills
 Terrific analytical skills
 A good sense for processes and process optimization
 Structured, goal-oriented and independent way of working
 Organizational talent
 Reliability
 Entrepreneurial thinking




Why ICONIC Sales?

    We are the leading Amazon agency from Germany and are now conquering the UK. With over 54 employees at ICONIC SALES and over 165 employees across the company group, ICONIC London will be a new benchmark and lead the international expansion. Be part of it With an attractive overall package, you have a unique opportunity here. 
   




About us

    We lead small & medium-sized enterprises (SMEs) to success on Amazon. We see ourselves as a serious partner at eye level with vision & competence. We ensure increasing sales, sustainable developments and brand awareness. Originally founded in 2015, we have focused on Amazon since 2018 and are now 51 employees at ICONIC Sales itself and over 165 employees across the group. Different teams perfectly cover the requirements of our customers with innovative solutions. We are characterised by a high level of innovation, a homogeneous team structure and a strong dynamic. We challenge and encourage employees who want to make a difference and change things. Get to know us and we will show you how ICONIC works!

name: National Account Manager
summary: Be accountable for the Commercial relationships with our Indirect partners, supporting them to grow their business on an omni-channel basis.
description:
National Account Manager, Indirect


 PPD UKI


 Location: National


 Fixed Term





 When you look at L’Oréal, what do you see? If all you see is lipstick, look again and experience the Freedom to go Beyond the ordinary. That’s the beauty of L’Oréal. We operate in 150 countries on 5 continents. With 36 international brands and 86,000 employees worldwide, we’re well on our way to fulfilling our common purpose: to create beauty that moves the world.
  


 By 2030 we want to capture over another 1 billion consumers around the world. How? By creating cosmetic products which meet the infinite diversity of consumers beauty needs and desires, and always through digital innovation. Not only that, but taking our sustainability goals seriously; moving us to a more inclusive and sustainable society, for every generation.
  


 Our brands, dynamic culture, and always being our own challenger mean that we offer freedom and opportunity you won’t get anywhere else.
  


 If you want the Freedom to go Beyond, we’ll see you at L’Oréal.
  


 In the Professional Products Division, our mission is to support hairdressers and develop the hair industry sustainably, while benefiting all. We’re the founding Division for the L’Oréal group, having history more than 110 years ago.
  


 Here, you’ll be constantly looking to create connections between our brands, professionals and consumers in every market. Our mission is to always reinvent professional beauty and lead the digital transformation of our industry with a customer-centric approach.
  


 The Professional Products Division is universally known for exclusively supplying salons and other professional customers with the most advanced technologies in hair and beauty products. The 8 brands within this division are L’Oréal Professionnel, Kérastase, Shu Uemura Art of Hair, Redken, Pureology, Matrix, Biolage and Pulp Riot. Our brands have made us the world leader in professional beauty products and one of the most dynamic places to pursue your career in the UK.
  




 You will:



 Be accountable for the Commercial relationships with our Indirect partners, supporting them to grow their business on an omni-channel basis.
 Have ownership of the commercial strategy.
 With support of the Senior National Account Manager, build bespoke and relevant strategies and plans of execution for each route to market (eCom, Direct & Store).
 Turn data into insight into action, by working with available data sources and category management.
 Own and negotiate joint business planning process with the customer.
 Align on the objectives, goals, strategy & measures with customer to drive sell-out growth.
 Develop and coach respective team members to drive performance across areas of responsibilities.
 Work with other key Functions to ensure cohesive working practices across the business.
 Have sensitivity for brand priorities.
 Drive the marketing and education agenda, with particular focus on Access.
 Demonstrate excellence of supply planning with customer services.
 Engage in joint Commercial decision making with finance business partner.
 Manage and drive performance of the P&L - Gross Sales to Gross Profit.
 Manage minorations Control within budgeted levels.
 Be responsible for maintenance of healthy levels of stock in trade.
 Be responsible for accuracy of forecast/phasing.
 Conduct pre & post evaluation of activity to drive ROI and investment efficiencies.
 Be responsible for growth of customers to budgeted levels.
 Be responsible for growth of customer sell out to grow market share.
 Collaborate with peers to share best practice and ensure multi-channel alignment.
 Work with brand and education teams to keep up to date on all launches and brand initiatives.
 Foster close working relationships with customer contacts.





 You are:



 Entrepreneurial. Every single day, you spot opportunities to shake things up.
 Super creative. There’s no blueprint for the future. You’ll have to design it.
 Adventurous. L’Oréal is for pioneers. So you’ll embrace challenges and change.
 Only human. You’ll make mistakes sometimes but you have no fear of failure because you’re smart enough to learn from mistakes.
 Ambitious. You crave success and we’ll support you all the way. That way, we all win.
 Respectful. Whoever you’re talking to, you treat everyone the same.
 One of the gang. Even if you’re Superman or Wonder Woman, you recognise that teams are the real heroes. And so do we.
 Open. To new ways of doing things. To other people’s (sometimes crazy) ideas.
 You. You’re real. And you’re true to yourself. We cherish and celebrate diversity so you’ll feel right at home whoever you are.



 You have:



 In-depth knowledge of developing and delivering customer centric business plans
 Excellent communication and influencing skills with experience of building relationships across an organisation.
 A solutions-orientated mindset with the ability to work accurately at pace and cope with ambiguity.
 Experience of managing change - through rapid growth.
 Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
 Ability to analyse data, draw accurate conclusions and communicate key messages succinctly.
 Strong planning and organisation skills – with an ability to appropriately re-prioritise and change as required to meet deadlines.
 The ability to be risk aware and builds contingency into plans.





 You show:



 Ambition: You anticipate, think and dream big, demonstrating a high level of aspiration. You are self-driven and show proactivity, especially when seeing problems as challenges. You thrive for exceptional performance.
  


 Judgement: You can balance operational and strategic thinking, challenging the status quo and managing confrontation effectively. You cut quickly through complexity and ambiguity whilst also thinking sustainably and are future-oriented. You reduce complexity to get things done.
  


 Resilience: You always demonstrate purpose and ownership mindset but manage your own energy well. You uphold positivity for others and persist, bouncing back when faced with obstacles. You step back at times and accept limits.
  


 Empathy: You cooperate and network effectively, creating genuine and trustful relationships with diverse people. You are sensitive to beauty and related emotions, always supporting others and showing benevolence. You understand and respect others’ feelings and motives.
  


 Learning Agility: You are a self-motivated learner, showing self-awareness and demonstrating openness and curiosity. You experiment and learn from mistakes and past experiences, always showing courage and stepping out of your comfort zone. You support the development of a learning culture.
  


 You get:



 We put people development and learning at the heart of our business; we’ll help you master your role, develop your technical expertise and you’ll benefit from exceptional management and leadership programmes. From face-to-face workshops to our global online learning resources, you’re actively encouraged to embed learning into your daily life and are rewarded for continuous improvement. Don’t forget that every employee gets 3 Coursera credits; that means you can get qualifications from over 1000 universities from around the world, with thousands of courses to choose from.
  


 Looking for a good work/life balance? With our new hybrid working scheme, you can take a flexible approach to work as well as benefit from early finishes on Fridays during the summer...so you can enjoy more time with your friends and family.
  


 As any great employer should do, we make sure we look after your financial wellbeing. That’s why we have a great pension plan, profit share scheme and many more incentives to give you the security you deserve. We also put employee health and wellbeing at the front of everything we do; fully training employees as mental health ambassadors to support and educate ourselves further. There’s also the chance to enrol in medical and dental insurance, gym discounts, health check-ups and even yoga and Pilates classes to employees in all of our locations.
  


 Oh, did we mention that as an employee you also get discount sales of up to 70% off throughout the year on our 36 brands? Plus, you also get the option to share that in our Friends and Family sales as well!
  


 How we recruit



 At L’Oréal, we take pride in creating a diverse, equitable and inclusive environment where everyone is welcome and their contributions are valued. When we recruit, hire, train, promote or engage in any other employment practice, we are committed to being an inclusive employer regardless of race, religion, gender identity, sexual orientation, national origin, age, socioeconomic status, medical condition or disability, or any other protected status. When we look for talent, we welcome difference - different backgrounds, experiences, personalities and perspectives. The beauty we find in our differences gives us the freedom to go beyond. That’s the beauty of L’Oréal.
  





You can apply to up to three jobs within a rolling 30-day window. 
You cannot withdraw your application once you applied, so please make sure to choose a job that matches your dreams. 
Please visit "Your Application Space" to see the jobs you have already applied to. 
Please don’t create another account with a different email. If you do so, your account might be merged and your application record will be deleted.

description:
What to Expect


 *This role can be performed remotely from various locations within The UK*
 We are looking for an Account Manager to join our EMEA Utility and Commercial Storage Sales Team.


 As an Account Manager, you are responsible for selling our Megapack Battery Energy storage systems and associated offerings. You will lead projects from conception through contract execution with support from Tesla’s technical and commercial support teams.


 To be successful in this role, you bring strong technical knowledge of battery storage systems and business knowledge of the market for utility-scale energy storage. In addition, you have a proven track record in sales and account management, as well as strong communication and negotiation skills.


 What You’ll Do


 Achieve sales goals by managing a project pipeline of short, medium, and long-term opportunities spanning multiple countries and project types
 Develop sales opportunities by building and maintaining relationships with Independent Power Producers, developers, and utilities
 Collaborate with internal stakeholders from various departments to define scope, terms, and pricing for battery storage projects in a way that meets customers’ needs while protecting Tesla’s interests.
 Drive negotiation and contracting of equipment supply agreements, EPC agreements, O&M agreements, and related software sales agreements.
 Contribute to the strategy for and preparation of tender responses, in collaboration with Tesla’s Bid Team
 Maintain quality pipeline data and provide reporting to management as needed
 Evaluate market dynamics and drivers in assigned EMEA markets. Provide key market insights to the broader Tesla team, in support of determining and executing the most effective go-to-market strategy for each market.


 What You’ll Bring


 4+ years of commercial experience in the utility-scale electric generation or battery storage industry 
 Experienced with structuring and leading negotiations in energy, construction, project finance or a related practice area. Experience within the renewable energy industry is a plus
 A team player with the ability to proactively identify problems, drive projects to close, make complex cost/benefit assessments, and identify pragmatic legal and business solutions
 Strong interpersonal skills, with the ability to effectively communicate
 Flexibility to travel periodically (up to 25%)
 Fluent in English and ideally another relevant language such as German, Dutch, French, Spanish, Italian, Polish, Greek, Arabic, or Hebrew
 Note: relocation support is possible for non-local candidates

description:
Account Manager, UK 








Do you want to help improve food and health around the world?
At Oterra, we prioritise the food and health of our consumers and keep it at the heart of everything we do. We believe that nature got it right the first time, and as a leading manufacturer of colours from natural sources, we are here to make a difference in healthy living and sustainable agriculture. To ensure continuous success, we need the brightest and most passionate people on board. Want to join us?


The team
The Account Manager role will be part of the Northern Sales team. Our headquarter has doubled in size over the last year and will continue to grow in the years to come, representing the global organisation we support. In Oterra we have colleagues from across the whole world. Your day-to-day work will primarily be focused on sales development within UK.


In Oterra we thrive in a fast-paced environment, display a start-up mentality, and have an entrepreneurial approach to problem-solving in our operating model. We all chip in when and where it is needed, and have a flat structure, high standards, and a pragmatic viewpoint to support our business agenda.


The role
We are looking for an Account Manager to support our growth agenda with strong technical background. The successful candidate is a self-starter, knows what good looks like, and is a problem-solver with strong organisational and interpersonal skills. We are looking for someone who can work independently, but also as part of the team. This is a remote position based in UK.


What you will be doing:

Selling Oterra’s products to customers and distributors for the respective assigned customers.


Map individual customers in their own customer portfolio (sites, production, people, opportunities)


Plan and execute customer activities, including visits, trials, innovation days, etc


Build and maintain multi-level contacts across all accounts on a local level


Develop long-term customer plans for the main accounts in collaboration with Business Manager


Support and enter information to the best knowledge to support the demand planning


Providing technical advice regarding the proper use and adaptation of products to the production technology of the customer


Defining sales channels and processing structures in accordance with business criteria; organising or independently implementing sufficient support for agencies or traders to successfully optimise market potential.



Who are we looking for?
We need an additional team player, who has the resources to strengthen the image of Oterra as a reliable supplier of high-quality natural colours for the food industry. We are looking for a person that is motivated by working with people. The right candidate will have high standards, strong communication skills, and the ability to develop relationships. Other soft skills we really appreciate are being resilient, collaborative, and having a good sense of humour.


Key attributes to succeed:

Higher education degree or equivalent (B.A/M.Sc)


Previous technical sales experience of 5 years or more, experience in a B2B environment


Ability to learn and understand the product portfolio and application markets.


Strong proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite (Microsoft Outlook, Word, Excel and PowerPoint)


Proficient in CRM systems, preferably SalesForce®


Fluency in written and spoken English


Demonstrated experience in Food & Beverage


People’s skills



We offer
A unique opportunity to be part of the exciting build-up of our Sales team in Northern, Central, and Southern Europe, and to join us on our mission to be the best enablers of Oterra’s success. We offer continuous possibilities for learning in an international environment with competent and ambitious colleagues. You will contribute to our growth and development in the region. We have a flexible and modern way of working in a culture where we value differences, authenticity and each other. We offer a market-aligned compensation package and a truly international work environment.


If you need more information?
Read more about Oterra here: www.oterra.com. For more information about the role, please contact Adam Day adam.day@oterra.com


About Oterra
Oterra, an EQT portfolio company, is the largest provider of naturally sourced colours worldwide. Since our first colour launch in 1876, we’ve utilised the power of nature’s true colours and championed that natural is best.
We have unrivalled expertise in colours for food, beverage, dietary supplements and pet food, and help manufacturers bring appealing products to consumers around the world. We empower our partners to meet the demand for safe, sustainable and natural food on our journey together towards natural. Every day, over 400 million people consume a product that contains our colours in it.


At Oterra we are on an exciting growth journey where no two days are alike. We are a dedicated team of professionals around the world united in our belief that nature got it right the first time and that no one knows natural colours like us.


Our headquarter is in Hoersholm, Denmark, and we have production sites in Europe, Asia, Latin America and the US and more than 1400 team members in 30 countries worldwide, serving 120 markets globally.


Join us on our journey together towards natural!

 We have a fantastic opportunity for a permanent Account Manager to join our Ministry of Justice (MoJ) account in the following regions:
 North East and Yorkshire/Humberside region - responsible for 15 prisons in the region

 The salary is negotiable and attracts bonus.

You will work remotely with travel across the region, with direct reports from Regional Operations Managers.
 The standard hours of work are 39 hours per week.
 Work-life balance and flexibility are key for our success. We empower our people to make choices that are right for them, with hybrid, part-time and flexible work patterns. And with a network of offices across the UK, we’re open to discussing working options that suit you.
 You will be responsible for:

Delivering and improve upon agreed margins and cash flows.
Manage a P&L and balance sheet with responsibility for implementing the Divisional Business plan within the contract
Manage overall contract performance with regular site visits and performance review against targets
Lead, review and question contract budgets and forecasts to ensure consistent, challenging but deliverable approach adopted
Work with BDs, regional and contract teams to develop, manage and deliver annual business objectives, plans and budgets
Contribute to Bidding process in person or via support from contract
Manage supply chain to deliver service excellent and account profitability
This role will also support both local and business zero carbon programmes, working towards zero carbon in a strategic and lean manner as and where it is appropriate.
Responsible for ensuring H&S standards are achieved across the contract.

Experienced in delivering tangible financial performance (P&L and balance sheet) showing good business/commercial acumen within a contract
Proven ability to deliver on a complex account
Ability to manage, develop and motivate multiple teams remotely
Managed a medium to large P&L, up to c.£26m
Created and implemented a business plan
Delivered against a business plan/objective – including holding responsibility for the management of resources
Held a significant role supporting a bid or mobilisation
Managed a business improvement or change management project
Experienced in managing complex client relationships
Experience in H&S
IT and Data Analysis skills

 In addition to this, it would be desirable if you have experience of working within the public sector to help you hit the ground running, although this is not essential as we will provide you with the required development you need to bring you up to speed.

Holidays - Minimum 24 days holiday + Bank Holidays
Choices - Our flexible benefits scheme is tailored by you, including buying additional annual leave, cycle2work scheme, charity giving and gym membership

Social Value - You’ll get 2 Community Involvement Days each year to volunteer for a charity of your choice and further opportunities to support fundraising initiatives
Company Car / Car allowance

We embrace difference and support individuals to work in ways that work best for them.
 We are committed to working sustainably and by working in partnership with the communities we serve, so people and the planet are protected.
 At Amey, you have freedom to perform because we know if nothing holds you back, together, we can be extraordinary.
Who is Amey?

We are at the heart of modern Britain, helping the economy to grow by designing, maintaining and transforming the nation’s strategic assets.


Our 11,000 people are behind the critical services the country relies on every day.


Our unique engineering and operations experience, together with data driven insight from our consulting business, delivers better results for our clients.

description:
Every great story has a new beginning, and yours starts here.
 Welcome to Warner Bros. Discovery… the stuff dreams are made of.

 Who We Are… 
When we say, “the stuff dreams are made of,” we’re not just referring to the world of wizards, dragons and superheroes, or even to the wonders of Planet Earth. Behind WBD’s vast portfolio of iconic content and beloved brands, are the storytellers bringing our characters to life, the creators bringing them to your living rooms and the dreamers creating what’s next…

 From brilliant creatives, to technology trailblazers, across the globe, WBD offers career defining opportunities, thoughtfully curated benefits, and the tools to explore and grow into your best selves. Here you are supported, here you are celebrated, here you can thrive.

 Your New Role

 The UK business is going through a major transformation, pivoting from being almost 100%
 linear to being digital first, and our Sales team needs to reflect that. As a complement to our 3rd
 party sales reps we are building an innovative, passionate and industry respected in-house Ad
 Sales team.

 The mission for the Partnerships team at Warner Bros. Discovery is to maximise the revenue we deliver to the business by monetising every consumer interaction with our brands and content across all touchpoints. From linear TV, Discovery+ and across web and social. Our unique content strategy of super-serving passionate superfans of documentaries, reality, sport, home and food alongside entertainment pillars across reality, kids and films enables us to do this by helping brands to build meaningful interactions with highly engaged audiences.

 Within this dynamic and fast-growing team, Brand Partnerships delivers multi-platform creative solutions working with media agencies, clients and our third-party ad sales partners Sky Media, Channel 4 Sales and Mean Broadcast. The ability to build and maintain strong relationships as well as delivering on our deals and maximising growth both externally and internally is at the very heart of everything we do.

 Your Role Accountabilities 


Alongside the Senior Manager and Manager, be responsible for deal delivery and management across all closed deals across linear, digital, web and social. Delivery and Management elements include ensuring all deals are meeting their target parameters and updating worksheets for tracking of delivery.
 Support the Manager with inventory management across the entire WBD portfolio, identifying each channel’s availability and communicating this to the wider teams, including working with the Account Manager to ensure the worksheets are updated bi-weekly. This includes ensuring we are identifying correct inventory status with Digital Ad-Ops for existing deals but also communicating these to the Sales teams for brief responses.
 Responsible for coordinating information to and being the lead for the Commercial Operations team and all deal set up and maintenance within the BTS system.
 Work closely with and support the Sales & Strategy Team and Digital Teams alongside the Senior Manager and Manager to deliver highly professional results and advise on continuing sales strategy and opportunities for all media agencies and clients.
 Supporting with the response on active and proactive briefs with the Sales team
 Ownership of maintaining the Partnerships Availability grid ensuring all information is up to date and accurate on a weekly basis
 Supporting the Manager with maintaining the Partnerships Status Report including the update of every deal, content and Clash grids and communicating these weekly with the Sales & Strategy teams and wider business where required.
 Ownership of programming and scheduling updates which requires a good relationship with the Scheduling teams and coordinating and attending regular meetings and exchanging of information which can then be shared within the wider team
 Responsible for creation of sales collateral including flyers and programming decks alongside and responsibility for ensuring these are regularly updated and all information is accurately sourced and communicated.
 Lead on use of TGI research tool to support sales collateral and support brief responses working closely with the Commercial Insights Manager across TGI.
 Keep up to date on market activity and competitor analysis


 Skills and Qualifications

 Likely to have at least 2 years experience in Media or broadcast: in Media Agencies, Client-side or media owner
 Ability to manage multiple complex projects & deliverables
 Able to establish and maintain influential relationships, especially with Media Agencies
 Is confident enough to deal with people of all levels, from assistant to MD
 Demonstrates a good understanding of client’s business needs
 Demonstrates good consumer understanding and insights


 How We Get Things Done…

 This last bit is probably the most important! Here at WBD, our guiding principles are the core values by which we operate and are central to how we get things done. You can find them at www.wbd.com/guiding-principles/ along with some insights from the team on what they mean and how they show up in their day to day. We hope they resonate with you and look forward to discussing them during your interview.

 About the job


 Job summary

 IPSA is an independent body that regulates and administers the business costs and decides the pay and pensions of the 650 elected Members of Parliament and their staff in the UK. In fact, we were the first independent regulator of its kind in any of the world’s democracies.
 Our mission is simple: we want to enable MPs to do what really matters by providing an exemplary, seamless regulatory service. We’re guided by our values and our brilliant, inclusive culture ensures we’re not only a great place to work but that we can also constantly adapt, evolve and improve everything we do so that we can meet our customers' needs.
 Take a look at some of our videos to find out more about who we are, what we do and how we do it:



 What do IPSA do?
 Working at IPSA






 Job description

 We’re looking for a brilliant new team member to join us, who can help us deliver our mission and provide comprehensive support to our customers, ensuring their issues are resolved and options considered whilst ensuring MPs comply with the MPs Scheme of Staffing and Business Costs. The role is IPSA’s first point of contact for our customers; offering advice, guidance and information, taking and making telephone calls, responding to emails and attending face to face meetings. The role also plays an important part in inducting and educating customers on IPSA’s systems and processes and offers significant opportunity to contribute to the continuous improvement of operational activity that supports achievement of IPSA’s strategic objectives.
 The Scheme can be perceived as complex and the role holder will need a full understanding of all its aspects, maintaining knowledge of relevant data, processes and systems to make life easier for MPs and their staff so they can focus on what really matters by delivering advice and support to MPs and their staff about how to access funding, manage budgets and ensure spending falls within the rules.
 We’re looking for someone with excellent listening skills to help them understand our customers, and someone who can collaborate with other teams across IPSA to meet these needs efficiently and effectively, as well as fostering compliance with the Scheme of MPs’ Staffing and Business Costs through customer service excellence. Speaking with customers and building strong and productive relationships is core to this role. MP Services is a forward thinking and high performing team that values its people and its customers and as we’re fixated with continuous improvement, we need resilient people with a flexible mindset to help us evolve and improve.
 This is a brilliant opportunity for a calm and collected customer service champion, who thinks logically and works enthusiastically with all our colleagues and expressive customers to deliver an exemplary customer experience. 
MP Services Account Managers responsibilities include:

 Enabling MPs and their staff to comply with the Scheme through providing excellent customer service.
 Educating MPs and their staff on processes and systems.
 Supporting MPs and their staff to manage their financial position and budgets.
 Enabling MPs to register properties and claim reimbursements of business costs.
 Inputting data and monitoring accuracy of data to support decision-making.
 Supporting the process of validating business cost claims and recovering amounts over overspend, where necessary.
 Engaging with external stakeholders and collaborating with external partners. 
Contributing to IPSA’s continuous improvement culture.
 Undertaking other projects.

 The MP Services Directorate includes two customer-facing teams: one team delivers advice and support to MPs and their teams about how to access funding, manage budgets and ensure spending falls within the rules, while the other team delivers advice and support about how to register properties with IPSA to access the funding that goes with them. Depending on operational requirements, you’ll be recruited to one of these teams at your time of appointment and you may be required to move between teams in future to continue to meet the needs of our customers and your own personal development.



 Person specification

 You’ll be passionate about delivering excellent customer service and helping us to deliver our vision of enabling MPs to focus on what really matters by providing an exemplary, seamless, regulatory service. You’ll dazzle people with your boundless energy, and you’ll have a positive influence on how our customers feel about us through understanding their needs and priorities. Through a collaborative approach to your work, sound communication skills and great attention detail, you will build bridges and you’ll be adept at communicating complex and challenging financial information to MPs and their staff, proactively supporting MPs to spend wisely and within the guardrails of the Scheme. 
Working with others but being accountable for achieving great results in your own work and also for IPSA is key so you’ll be confident in planning your own workload and you’ll be curious and analytical about the data you work with to ensure it’s right first time, every time. 
You’ll be working in a pressured environment so resilience is a must, and you’ll need great listening and observational skills too. High initiative and a flexible approach to work and change are important. You’ll be joining a high-performing team where resilience is a key attribute, and given the remit of the role, the ability to work dynamically with an unwavering commitment to meeting our own performance metrics is important. Above all, you’ll live and breathe IPSA’s values and be able to demonstrable how your experience and ways of working align with these.
 A full job description and person specification is available on the ‘current vacancies’ section on our website.
 Location 
We’re a hybrid organisation with employees working in all corners of the UK. We have an office in central London which you can work from, although we welcome applications from all across the UK, offering flexible homeworking on UK mainland locations (which includes Northern Ireland).



 Benefits




 A competitive salary which is regularly benchmarked against industry. 
Hybrid and flexible working, with occasional travel to London for team meetings 
Generous contributions into a ‘Civil Service’ pension. 
25 days holiday entitlement (+ bank holidays), increasing by 1 day each year up to 30 days.
 Option to purchase additional holiday days each year.
 Access to learning and development tailored to your role with coaching opportunities.
 Working in a high-performing organisation which supports democracy with a great team ethic.
 A culture encouraging equity, diversity and inclusion. 
Time in your work to time to participate in our inclusive workplace networks.
 Mental Health First Aid network and access to our EAP 
Enhanced family leave provisions
 Workplace awards programme for living IPSA’s values and innovative ideas.
 Season ticket/rent deposit loans.
 Cycle to work scheme.
 Give As You Earn scheme.
 Volunteering days and ‘you’ time.




 Things you need to know


 Selection process details


 We’re committed to making IPSA a brilliant place to work and at the heart of our people philosophy is our promise to engage, enable and empower every member of our team to deliver excellence, learn and develop each day. Through a diversity of backgrounds, experience and thought IPSA will continue to be a high-performing organisation with a truly diverse and inclusive culture. We’re guided by our values and live and breathe them through all the work that we do. These are Staying Connected, Seeing the Bigger Picture, Being Open, Doing the Right Thing and Making a Difference. As a values-based organisation you can expect these to feature throughout the recruitment process and beyond.
 How to apply
 If you feel like you’re a good fit for this role and for IPSA then we’d love to hear from you. Please send us your CV and a one-page cover letter to careers@theipsa.org.uk. We ask you to be succinct in your cover letter highlighting why you’d be a great match. It’s always a good idea to cross reference your letter with the key elements of the role, person specification and focus on some of your key achievements which might be relevant to this role and how you align to our values.
 Before you apply, please take a moment to read the ‘how to apply’ section on our website which details our approach to reducing unconscious bias in our recruitment process. 
Interview process and timeline
 Interviews will be virtual via Microsoft Teams, so you’ll need access to a secure WIFI network and a private space. Our interviews are competency-based, and we’ll ask you a series of questions designed to help assess your suitability for the role and for IPSA, and we may also ask you prepare a short presentation.
 The closing date for this role will be Sunday 09 July, so we encourage you to submit your application without delay. Shortlisting will take place in w/c 10 July and interviews will take place on 18 and 19 July.
 Due to the high number of applications, we expect to receive for this role we will only contact you if your application is shortlisted for interview. Feedback will only be provided after interview.

 Jisc is the UK higher, further education and skills sectors’ not-for-profit organisation for digital services and solutions. We believe education and research improves lives, and technology improves education and research. 
  
 Our vision is for the UK to be a world leader in technology for education and research and our mission is to power and empower our members with the technology and data they need to succeed. We know that digital technology has the ability to transform the student experience. We have the experience, expertise and know-how to drive that transformation. 
  
 About the role: 
   OpenAthens, part of Jisc has the vision to become the world’s most user-friendly information access management experience, helping academics, students, scientists and library patrons gain access to the knowledge they need to achieve great things. This role sits in the sales and marketing team who are key to delivering our ambitious growth plans worldwide and maintaining our high customer retention rate with both libraries and publishers. 
  
 This is an exciting time of growth and we are looking for an ambitious individual to help deliver our strategic sales plan by owning the ambitious sales and customer retention targets for direct customers, as well as managing a 3rd party reseller to reach their retention targets. You will also work closely with the Product and Marketing teams to inform strategy, whilst prioritising both online and onsite visits to key accounts. 
  
 You will need to have extensive sales or account management experience in B2B/scholarly publishing, libraries, SAAS for Edtech or Identity / Access Management as experience in this complex space is key to ensuring you can engage in depth with both libraries and publisher customers. 
  
 Although this is a remote role and you will be based from home for the majority of the time there is a requirement to travel to our London and Bristol offices for team meetings plus some on-site customer visits. You must also be able to work flexibly to accommodate US customers during their core working hours and to travel to the US/abroad when required. 
  
 Other responsibilities will include: 
  

Deliver customer revenue retention targets on customer accounts worth £1,500,000 
Hold high level meetings with key customer stakeholders, face to face and online 
Travel domestically and internationally (if required), to meet customers/attend industry events 
Inform product strategy with relevant customer insight 
Analyse a range of information, see relevance and draw conclusions to meet customer and organisational needs 
Engage technical colleagues to explain more complex concepts to customers during both pre-sales and post sales processes 
Explain technical details and requirements to a non-technical audience, using simplified language to gain customer understanding 

 Key Skills and Experience required: 
  

Must have extensive sales or account management experience in B2B/scholarly publishing, libraries, SAAS for Edtech or Identity / Access Management 
Demonstrable track record of exceeding targets 
Experience of relationship management 
Able to learn complex technical concepts/language and translate into meaningful customer conversations 
High level negotiation and influencing skills 
Focussed on delivering excellent customer experience 

 Don’t meet every single requirement? 
   We know that sometimes people can be put off applying for a job if they think they can’t tick every box but we realise the ‘perfect candidate’ doesn’t exist. So, if you can do most of what we’re looking for, go ahead and apply. You may be just the right candidate for this or other roles! 
  
 Why work at Jisc: 
   At Jisc, everyone plays a key role and gets the chance to feel part of it, that to us is the definition of a meaningful career. We want to create a culture of lifelong learning. You can look forward to a rewarding job with opportunities to develop and make a real difference to the education and research sectors. 
  
 We celebrate diversity, embrace our differences and know that this is critical for our success. We work hard to make sure we’re inclusive and we are committed to furthering our culture of inclusion. So, if you are great at what you do and share our values, we want to hear from you. 
  
 At Jisc we believe a balance between your personal and professional life is essential to your happiness and fulfilment. We work flexibly at Jisc and focus on outputs rather than presenteeism and are open to a whole range of ways of working. It isn’t about how many hours you spend at home or at work; it’s about the flow you establish that brings energy to both parts of your life. 
  
 Our benefits are great too. We offer: 
  

Flexible work pattern, which can adapt to suit your schedules and personal commitments 
28 days annual leave (plus bank holidays) and an additional three closure days over Christmas 
A generous pension scheme with above average employer contributions 
A range of leave options, including parental leave, volunteer leave and even career breaks. 
A generous budget to attend conferences and in-person training 
Allocated allowance of up to £250 to equip your home office 
A company culture which supports and promotes personal learning and development, including access to thousands of courses on LinkedIn Learning 
Mental health first aid trained staff and supportive environment, plus your own Wellbeing allowance to spend on wellbeing for you 
Financial well-being support 
Discounts on big-name high-street stores 
Cycle to work scheme 
Employee recognition awards and travel loans 

 Equality, diversity and inclusion 
   At Jisc, we strive to be best in practice and are working hard to achieve progressive change. ‘Always inclusive’ is one of our six guiding principles - a principle which actively encourages acceptance of differences within individuals. 
  
 We are committed to equal employment opportunities regardless of race, colour, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, neurodivergence, trans status, veteran status or gender identity.

name: JUNIOR ACCOUNT EXECUTIVE
summary:
Managing day-to-day operations of an account with an account.
Your role will primarily involve working directly with our clients PPC delivery.
description:
Looking to start a career in Online Advertising? Our client is looking for an  analytic fanatic with a creative spark to join their team of specialists in the  heart of Bicester. 
Your role will primarily involve working directly with our clients PPC delivery  team to help us setup and manage awesome paid advertising campaigns  across the Google and Microsoft channels (including Search, Shopping, and  Display Campaigns), and via paid social channels such  as Facebook, Instagram and LinkedIn. 
This role will involve a lot of performance analysis of the campaigns our  client is running for customers whose businesses span a wide variety of  different industry sectors. One minute you might be working with an  electronics brand, the next maybe an industrial B2B type. The diversity of  work means you’ll rarely have a dull day. You’ll then get to implement the  changes decided following on from the analysis helping to keep the  campaigns nice and optimised. 
You’ll help to launch new campaigns which involves performing keyword  and audience research, and then setting up new campaigns and building  ads. As your knowledge and experience grows you will also have the  opportunity to manage your own accounts, and will become the main point  of contact for a number of customers. 
While the role is largely campaign and client management, there will be  opportunities to get stuck in and help the wider business. Internal  marketing, business development, and planning are all responsibilities that  can be shared if this is something you have an interest in. 
The Individual 
We didn’t just say “analytic fanatic” because it sounded good (well, maybe a  little); being comfortable around large volumes of data is a must for this role.  We don’t need you to be an Einstein-level maths whizz, but a strong  numerical base is crucial. In addition, you’ll also be comfortable analysing 




the data from campaigns and be able to weave this into narratives that our  clients customers will not only understand but appreciate. 
You need to be comfortable dealing with people, and have the ability and  confidence to clearly present information both internally and externally via a  number of different mediums, whether it’s written or verbal. Passion,  ambition and curiosity are all great traits in any candidate as they  demonstrate your ability to be a good team player who will contribute to  our clients ongoing success. 
About the company 
Our client is more than just a team of PPC specialists, they are constantly  looking to expand their knowledge, always looking to improve using the  latest innovations. They like to think of themselves as a fun lot – they have a  strong sense of team, embrace unique personalities and celebrate the  things that make each person different. This is a mentality we’ll be looking  for you to share. 
What’s In It For You? 
As our client progresses and develops as a company, you will too. They are  committed to ensuring that you’re constantly learning new skills, being  challenged while also feeling valued and supported. They will develop a  training programme tailored specifically to help you get up to speed with  what they do, learn how everything works, and pass your Google exams  while ensuring that your strengths and passions are being nurtured. 
They are an "anti-agency" agency, as strange as that may sound. While they  are a modern team who offer flexibility, they try to avoid at all costs the  superficial vibes that so many agencies shoot for. So if you like the idea of  working in digital marketing, rather than the reality of working in digital  marketing, this position won’t be for you. 
But if you have a desire to become really good (and by that we mean, really  really good) at an aspect of digital marketing that isn’t going  anywhere anytime soon, we’d love to hear from you. 
About the company 
Our client is just starting a new chapter in our agency, having recently  moved into a brand new office space in the heart of one  of Oxfordshire’s finest business communities. The space has been designed  to maximise productivity, and is a beautiful space to work. It’s also based in  the centre of town where we have many shops and restaurants on our  doorstep – fancy a Nando’s lunch? You got it! Got a coffee craving? Costa is  just around the corner! 
Their friendly atmosphere, coupled with our resident office dog, Nala makes  our client a forward-thinking, relaxed company that doesn’t try too hard to 




be trendy. Flexi-time and the ability to work from home are central to our  culture. Most importantly, we value a great work-life balance above all. 
Interested? 
Super!

Managing day-to-day operations of an account with an account 
manager 
   
Managing delivery of Pay Per Click campaigns - reviewing 
performance data - what ads / keywords are working etc. 
   
Relationship with client - able to hold conversations - you are the 
representative and need to help the client 'get it' and simplify the 
    terminology 
   
Drive the creative vision 

Candidate Requirements: 
Must haves: 

Self-starting and can-do attitude 
Strong communications skills 
Data experience with Excel - happy to spend a lot of time in front of 

spreadsheets 
Nice to haves: 

A year of previous PPC / marketing work experience 

Benefits: 

Flexible working hours (Between 9am and 6pm) 
Hybrid working - 2 days a week from the office and the rest from 


    home (After your probation period) 
    

Bonus scheme - profit share available 
Competitive salary 
Quarterly performance-based activities

 You will be working in the field and remotely to manage a well-established patch in London and the South East. The role is hybrid, with a maximum of 1-2 days per week in the field with clients, with the rest over Teams/Zoom from home.
 The successful candidate will be responsible for achieving individual sales revenue and activity targets, as well as converting new business prospects in the region. This role offers a competitive base salary of up to £55,000, as well as a £15,000 uncapped OTE, and a fully expensed company car. The OTE is paid monthly and is guaranteed for the first four months on joining!
 This role will require an individual who is capable of designing strategic account plans tailored to each customer, and able to follow through to conclusion each element of their strategic account plan. Excellent presentation and communication skills are essential, as you will be required to present to large groups when needed, as well as interpret data and information in review meetings with customers.  You will also be responsible for managing the customer base to deliver first-class account management with regular and timely review meetings and feedback, as well as ensuring that all accounts have a clear understanding of our client's products and pricing structure and to deliver value-added solutions against their business needs.  As a Key Account Manager, you will also need to liaise with internal support functions such as Customer Services and Finance to ensure smooth management of the billing & administration process for your customer base, plus the provision of any supporting sales reports.  It’s essential that you are a positive role model and ambassador of our client's company values and behaviours, and take responsibility for self-development to support the achievement of personal objectives while being part of a team.

What we need from you–


3+ years minimum experience in a field-based Account Manager role
Experience of selling a service rather than a tangible product
Experience of dealing with complex data
Experience planning a patch or sales territory
Proven experience of overcoming price objections. Ideally you will come from an industry where you can’t negotiate on price
B2B sales experience is essential
You’ll have experience successfully applying a sales methodology, such as Challenger, SPIN, SNAP etc


What you’ll get–


Up to £45,000 - £55,000 (depending on experience)
Fully expensed company car (not car allowance)
Achievable, uncapped £15,000 annual OTE
OTE is paid monthly and is guaranteed for the first four months on joining
25 Days Holiday + Bank Holidays
Great additional benefits, such as private healthcare for you and your dependents
Support in your professional development and excellent progression opportunities from Account Manager to the next level


 If you’re a driven individual, looking for a career in a fast-paced, customer-focused environment, this could be the perfect opportunity for you. So, don’t miss out and apply today!
 If you are interested in this Key Account Manager role, please apply ASAP or contact Alex Bradley. This vacancy is being advertised by Post Recruitment Ltd. The services advertised by Post Recruitment Ltd are those of an Employment Agency, visit our website for more details.

description:
Position Title: Account Manager
 

   Location: Remote (UK based)
 


   About GTT:
 

   GTT provides secure global connectivity, improving network performance and agility for your people, places, applications, and clouds. We operate a global Tier 1 internet network and provide a comprehensive suite of cloud networking and managed solutions that utilize advanced software-defined networking and security technologies.
 


   We serve thousands of businesses with a product portfolio that includes various Managed Networking Services, Managed Security Services including, DDoS, MDR, FWaaS, SWG, CASB, and ZTNA Secure Connect internet, Cloud Connect Services (Google, AWS and MS Azure) and Global Voice Services (SIP Trunking, CCP for Cisco Webex Calling, MS Teams Operator Connect and Zoom Phone.
 


   All of the above solutions are underpinned with GTT’s comprehensive range of Professional Services, including Project Management, Technical Management, Service Management, Customer Incident Management and Program Management. Our customers benefit from a customer-first service experience underpinned by our commitment to operational excellence. For more information on GTT, please visit 
  
   www.gtt.net
  .
 


   Role Summary:
 

   An Account Manager at GTT is not only at the forefront of GTT sales dedicated to finding our next new name customers, but also penetrates our existing client base seeking new opportunities, understanding their challenges, matching their needs with GTT services, and most importantly closing the deals whilst ensuring your customers benefit from a customer-first experience.
 


   Duties and Responsibilities:
 



     Scheduling promotional work and tracking sales activities; quoting prices, preparing proposals and providing information regarding terms and delivery, and negotiating contracts.
   


     Developing new business within assigned region or industry; gathering data on marketing trends, competitive products and pricing.
   


     Presenting products or services for stakeholders, answering any customer questions and addressing their needs.
   


     Prospecting new business, setting and closing appointments with key decision makers, servicing existing business and developing strong client relationships.
   


     Penetrates existing companies deeper to understand pain points and sniff out further opportunities
   


     Sells GTT’s full suite of products and solutions Including connectivity (SD-WAN, MPLS, Internet),
   


     Profiles key customers and seeks companies with a decision-making unit and considerable international footprint.
   


     Work with the considerable marketing support available to drive further prospecting initiatives.
   


     Drive opportunities from discovery, through development to close.
   



   Required Experience/Qualifications:
 



     Must be confident and hungry to engage with C level executives on their business challenges and translating needs into benefits.
   


     Knowledge of Cloud, Network Security and Networking or Communications.
   


     Be ambitious, competitive with a winning mentality.
   


     Be comfortable with technical topics.
   


     You enjoy sales, treat it as an art form and enjoy having fun with the team.
   


     Excellent written and verbal communication skills. (English)
   


     Knowledge of applicable sales methodologies (Challenger, SPIN, Miller Heiman etc).
   


     5-10+ years enterprise sales experience
   



   Core Competencies
 



     Business Acumen: Knowledge of business concepts, tools, and processes that are needed for making sound decisions in the context of the company's business; ability to apply this knowledge appropriately to diverse situations.
   


     Effective Communications: Understanding of effective communication concepts, tools and techniques; ability to effectively transmit, receive, and accurately interpret ideas, information, and needs through the application of appropriate communication behaviors.
   


     Negotiating: Knowledge of successful negotiation concepts and techniques; ability to negotiate successfully across the organization and with external vendors and clients in a constructive and collaborative manner.
   


     Problem Solving: Knowledge of approaches, tools, techniques for recognizing, anticipating, and resolving organizational, operational or process problems; ability to apply knowledge of problem solving appropriately to diverse situations.
   


     Networking: Understanding of the business value of creating mutually beneficial relationships with individuals outside of incumbent's own organization and ability to generate productive relationships with internal and external partners that improve access to resources and expertise.
   


     Sales Proposals and Presentations: Knowledge of sales processes, tools, and techniques; ability to prepare and present formal recommendations for how the organization can meet the customer's needs.
   


     Value Selling: Knowledge of the principles and practices for selling products, technology and services; ability to provide overall product/service 'value' and to differentiate support offerings that address clearly understood customer needs.
   



   Universal Competencies
 



     Continuous Improvement: Knowledge of transformation initiatives to drive fundamental changes, enhance responsiveness and efficiency to core business practices. Ability to drive cultural changes from best effort to results oriented.
   


     Customer First (Customer Facing): Knowledge of internal customer interactions, creating a culture of accountability, collaboration, and partnership. Ability to build an environment supporting internal customer value creation at every level.
   


     Operational Excellence: Understanding the system-driven processes for consistency and scalability. Ability to re-focus processes and systems from integration activity to maximizing a positive customer impact and anticipating future trends.

Overview:

 Populate Social London / Hybrid  £Dependant on experience + Benefits
 Who we are:
 We're Populate, Cardiff's homegrown social media marketing agency. We create content for brands all across the UK and Europe, primarily focused on the B2C space. We believe in social that has impact. Not just pretty pictures and fluffy strategies; purpose, transparency, and genuine results make us tick.

As a team of 20 dedicated professionals, we are part of The MISSION Group, a network of more than 1000 individuals spread across three continents and 18 agencies. It is an exciting time to join the Populate journey and we're looking for incredibly talented people to join us.
 What to expect

 Keeping on top of your clients’ projects; making sure they’re looked after effectively, managing both your own tasks and the core tasks of those that are also involved in the account.
 Working across various platforms such as Facebook, Instagram, TikTok, Twitter, Pinterest, LinkedIn, and YouTube.
 Working alongside our creative team, writing creative briefs, helping with the logistics of shoots, research and idea planning, occasionally required on set. Being the last sign off for content and ensuring it's created within the brand guidelines of your clients.
 Working alongside our paid ads team, briefing the ads team, reviewing paid ad performance and relaying campaign performance and what the results mean to clients—this requires understanding the fundamentals of digital advertising to field basic questions the client may have.
 Keeping on top of new developments in the social industry and applying these to your work and client accounts.
 Gain a thorough understanding of your clients’ business’ and major trends shaping their markets.
 Ensuring work is produced to the best quality, on time and within budget.
 Campaign planning and strategy.
 Summarising data and results and writing reports.
 Engagement—both proactive and reactive.
 Scheduling content using third party software.
 Crafting engaging copy, both long and short-form.
 Lots of comms with your clients—whether it's updating them on the amazing results we've been generating, taking them for a coffee and catching up about their daughter's latest escapades in the school nativity or chasing them up because we've been asking for the same piece of content for weeks!

 The Right Stuff

 3+ years of experience in social media management/marketing, ideally in an agency or consumer-facing brand environment.
 Experience and knowledge across a mix of social channels, especially Facebook, Instagram and TikTok.
 Copywriting skills must be sharp with the ability to write in multiple tones of voice, ability to be concise and can spot a typo a mile off.
 A strategic thinker that has a good understanding of both social media strategies and the wider marketing mix.
 A confident communicator—both in person and over the phone.
 We have a lot of paid advertising clients, so experience of managing advertising campaigns is important—this doesn’t mean you’ll be building or implementing them! But you’ll need experience in writing campaign briefs, speaking with the paid team to make changes, analyse the performance of campaigns, a knowledge of key metrics (CPA, CPC, CTR, CPM, ROAS etc) and how they affect performance.
 Previous experience and proven ability to handle a busy workload, prioritise and be flexible is super important.
 You demonstrate initiative at every turn and have a real 'can-do' attitude.
 You smash out good work and take pride in what you do; you hiss at the ‘that’ll do’ attitude.
 Enjoy collaborating with others and working as part of a growing team.
 You're the kind of person who is always looking for and learning from new information and experiences.

 GREAT to have but not essential:

 Basic knowledge of Adobe Platforms (Illustrator, InDesign, Photoshop).
 Good understanding of Facebook Ads Manager and Facebook Business Manager.
 Experience of working on multiple accounts in an agency environment is preferred.
 An understanding of Asana would be hugely beneficial.

 Why Populate?

 Company bonus available, dependent on performance and company profit
 Personal development budget and dedicated development days
 35 days holiday, including an extra day off for your birthday + Christmas Eve too
 We're pretty relaxed here—doctors, dentist, house viewing appointments etc doesn't have to be taken as holiday
 Commission on any new business you bring in
 Work and collaborate alongside our close-knit team full of social media experts
 No-one to look after your dog this week? We have an open-door policy for your pup from time to time as they need love too!
 Great company culture; a supportive and feedback-orientated office environment equipped with team lunches and socials
 Access to our menu of company benefits, varying from blue lens computer glasses to private medical insurance
 Company-wide retreat once a year
 Office based in the city centre
 Pension-related benefits

 Our dedicated oil, gas & LNG, power & renewables, chemicals, metals & mining sector teams are located around the world and deliver a variety of projects based on our assessment and valuation of thousands of individual assets, companies, and economic indicators such as market supply, demand, and price trends.
 We have over 1,900 employees in 30 locations, serving customers in nearly 80 countries. Together, we inspire and innovate the markets we serve – providing invaluable intelligence to help our customers overcome the toughest challenges, and make strategic decisions that will, ultimately, accelerate the world’s transition to a more sustainable future.



 Job Description
  Wood Mackenzie provides the data that transforms the way we power the planet – across every part of the energy and materials transition. The age of power and renewables has already begun. How will the global energy value chain respond to the great fuel switch? Wood Mackenzie provides detailed expert opinions about the future of renewable energy and what the energy transition could mean for the sector. This is an exciting time to join an organisation that is passionate about the Energy Transition and is supporting the change in the sector.
 We’re building a high-performance sales culture to match our unrivalled data, analytics and research solutions.
 If you like responsibility, enjoy accountability and know-how to drive growth from existing and new customers.
 Are you naturally curious? Are you a Problem Solver with the ability to quickly understand complex processes? Do you like to collaborate? Do you have a growth mindset and can you prove it?
 Then this role could be for you.
 Role Purpose
 The role sits within the European Financial & Professional Services sales team driving renewals, cross-sell opportunities and (critically) developing new customer sales; measured by sales results and contribution to the new business target.
 You will have responsibility for developing and maintaining relationships within our European client base, increasing penetration at the senior level and managing complex relationships across several different businesses and products as well as helping more new customers to choose Wood Mackenzie.
 We are looking for a self-starter, who will build on our existing relationships, identifying opportunities to solve more client problems with Wood Mackenzie solutions. You will thrive in the sales process – from prospecting to closing deals – to the challenges of winning new and cross-sell business and establishing new relationships within your territory.
 The successful candidate needs to be highly results-driven and demonstrate strong commercial acumen with excellent proactive new business development skills, as well as the rigorous application of process - including active use of the Salesforce CRM system. The successful candidate must demonstrate strong value-based selling skills.
 Key objectives include:

 Develop, coordinate and implement actionable retention and new business sales strategy designed to grow Wood Mackenzie’s current EMEARC Investment banking and Professional Services business.
 Deliver new business sales from Wood Mackenzie’s range of research and consulting offerings to achieve and exceed annual sales targets
 Develop prospect networks and drive relationships with key contacts to develop commercial relationships that lead to a deep understanding of clients’ existing needs and future requirements
 Demonstrate knowledge of the current market and industry trends, emerging technologies and competitors in this sector
 Time management with a focus on concurrently managing multiple sales opportunities
 Understanding and utilising client usage statistics and client training & engagement requirements

 Main Responsibilities

 Delivering renewals on time – ensuring quarterly targets are met
 Account growth – driving upsell and cross-sell opportunities within the set client base
 Territory growth – driving more companies to choose Woodmac for their Natural Resources intelligence
 Smart sales acumen demonstrated via pipeline management, sales qualification and CRM accuracy

 Key performance indicators

 Delivering your annual and quarterly business plan
 Delivering on-time renewals and meeting quarterly and annual targets
 Delivering growth through a new business pipeline
 Smart and consistent time management – ensuring new business pipeline is maintained as well as renewal process adhered to
 Support and follow up on all relevant sales plays/new business development initiatives
 Collaborative and client-centric behaviours




 Qualifications
  About you and how you can excel in the role
 You will:

 Have at least two years of experience in a Sales Account Manager or Territory Manager role

     Constant analysis of the performance & evolution of the assigned clients to increase HB’s sales as well as prevent any churn
   


     Generate new business opportunities via connecting new products or destinations, opening new markets, finding business gaps, promoting HB’s key business lines, etc.

 You will have the opportunity to work for a company that is going through significant change in becoming the world´s leading travel services provider. We are looking for people that are ready to ride the wave in this exciting journey.

     Within an innovative, engaging and multicultural environment.

  To aid in the protection of global key account operations through the reduction in the number of preventable incidents and to reduce incident impact through improvement of incident mitigation measures. The Incident Manager will be based within the Joint Operations Centre (JOC) in London and manage the ISS operational teams response to an Operational Facilities Incident which could potentially impact on the company through financial, regulatory or reputational damage.
 



  Responsibility for the delivery of Incident Management services within the global key account JOC supporting the global key account contract globally. You will be required to work on various shifts to facilitate a 24x7x365 on site presence. Shifts will include a combination of 12 hour days and 12 hour nights and will be office based.
 



  This role will work closely with the ISS Operational, Engineering and Global Service Centre teams as well as developing strong relationships within the Bank JOC and Risk teams.

Manage the upkeep and administration of the incident distribution lists.

Use reporting to create a pipeline of solutions to address incident hot spots / root causes.

Provide status reporting to account management teams.

Previous experience as an Incident Manager desirable
