description:
Job Purpose and Mission
 This job contributes to EMEA’s success by serving as a leader and influencer with our licensing partners ensuring joint supply chain plans that support business growth and reduce cost to serve. This role is part of Starbucks cross functional/licensing leadership teams to ensure holistic Licensing Framework programs . The role is accountable for developing licensee joint business plans to ensure alignment with the overall EMEA strategy, driving the Supply Chain strategy to support the business plans and implement changes/programs. To deliver this, this leader works in internal collaboration with the general manager, functional subject-matter-experts, and cross-functional virtual team members, and externally in partnership with functional lead within the licensee organisation. The position enables licensees to talk to one person within Supply Chain and evolves the role into the voice of the customer.


 Summary of Key Responsibilities


 Internal strategy setting - Represent the licensee’s strategic plans within the Starbucks Supply Chain team to influence and develop supply chain strategies in support of the licensees and Starbucks combined growth. As part of the Operating and Financial Plan, provide input on the design and supply chain impacts of strategic growth programs and the business case development to influence the internal team’s and licensee’s appetite for such projects.
 Prioritization/Defining focus - Develop and maintain strong relationships to represent Starbucks priorities and products and develops and executes strategies and plans to support accelerated growth, innovation and deliver quality, cost and service to customers, partners and shareholders. Use analytics to prioritize supply chain improvements and influences how these algin with the long term supply chain strategy. Ensure licensee operational needs are integrated with EMEA supply chain plans and activities. Build leadership team relationships to ensure Supply Chain requirements are included as a factor in business unit decisions and plans.
 Joint Business Planning - Advise and lead the Starbucks General Managers and licensees on all supply chain functions in key decision making meetings. In Joint Business Plan process with licensees ensure licensee plans and financial building blocks/targets are supported by EMEA supply chain plans balancing dynamic business priorities. Make recommendations to influence Starbucks and licensee supply chain strategies. Establish long-range objectives and definition of a strategy to optimize total supply chain design of Starbucks and licensees all focused to drive out costs, improve service and enable sales growth. Is accountable for delivering the supply chain performance goals/budget targets for more than 2 (large) licensing partners.
 Integrated Business Planning and Licensee performance management - Introduces Sales & Operations Planning to mature/complex markets and Monthly Market Reviews process with the aim to drive forecast accuracy improvement and cash flow improvement through lower inventory levels at Starbucks and licensees. Lead internal and external Key Business Reviews to track performance of Joint Business Plan and agree remedial actions/escalate issues where required. Lead and influence internally to ensure actions are completed by the Starbucks Supply Chain team as agreed as part of the Annual Operating Plan process. Provide insight and content for licensee and functional forums as required. Own the metrics defined within the KBR and ensures insights and updates to the quarterly forecasting process as it relates to supply chain. Proactively and regularly update the supply chain team on performance and insights of licensees.
 Performance management - Influence decisions related to product supply function costs (Inventory planning, Inventory forecasting, Inventory replenishment, and logistics) that support top-line growth and bottom-line profitability. Identify opportunities to scale success, over-come challenges and issues affecting results. Challenges others on performance.
 New licensees - Onboard new licensees, partner with the customer’s supply chain teams to establish detailed ways of working, processes, and opportunities for collaboration and connectivity as well as share expertise on existing supply chain network. Partner with the Legal team to deliver a robust supply agreement. Prepare SCO teams to understand the specific needs of the new customer, embed necessary routines into daily operations during start-up phase, and establish normalized routines thereafter.
 Integration - Connect with functional counterparts (internally & externally) to drive commitment to launch projects & agree execution. Where new programs are required, ensure supply chain impacts are considered and process put in place. Work with licensee to reach sufficient proof of concept and business case to enable prioritization and scaling across licensee’s market
 Project management - Design and execute integrated and cross functional projects to deliver short-term quick wins including the following core tasks: Develop business requirements, evaluate options, build alignment of stakeholders and project resources at manager and director level, construct timelines and deliverables, manage regular cadence meetings to keep project on time, influence others to deliver results, escalate risks and opportunities to leadership, document proven results and lessons learned, create and deliver clear presentations to all levels of the organisation. Streamline effective communication to keep internal and external stakeholders systematically and proactively informed of project progress. Supports region/market specific efforts – unique product offerings, volume surge management, training efforts, etc.

description:
Location: Remote + London, SE1 
Core Function: Account & Project Management 
Type: Permanent 
Reporting to: Group Account Director 
Salary: Competitive 


About the role
 Mediablaze is a digital marketing agency with unrivalled content marketing expertise. Using data to identify scalable growth opportunities throughout the path to purchase, we create connected customer experiences that help brands grow using three core service pillars: Content Marketing, Platform Design & Build and Performance marketing. 
We’re looking for an Account Manager to join our Client Services team at Mediablaze. You’ll be working within a fast-growing, tight-knit team to deliver excellent engaging digital marketing campaigns that drive growth for our clients businesses. 
The Client Services team is responsible for creating the conditions by which our clients love our work. We do this by building trust and exerting influence through deeper, more strategic relationships with our clients, and by driving, organising, leading and owning the powerful relationship between content, platforms and performance. 
Working alongside the Account Director and Group Account Director you will be responsible for the day to day delivery of high quality projects that provide content, technical and performance solutions designed to deliver real business results for our clients. 
You will have a client services mindset at the heart of everything you do, getting to know your customers inside-out. You will be well organised, can handle pressure, meet tight deadlines, and juggle many jobs at once to deliver projects on time and within budget.
 Responsibilities
 Client growth, Retention & Satisfaction

 You will be responsible for the day-to-day deliverables of your clients.
 Assist in managing total client satisfaction, identifying any issues or barriers and escalating as necessary. 
Extract pertinent information from your clients to construct ‘actionable and approved briefs’ for new initiatives that will deliver on their objectives, whilst maintaining oversight of ongoing work. 
Working with the Group Account Director and Account Director, negotiate cost estimates & proposals to ensure that all projects and contracts are priced to generate a good profit for the agency. 
Consistently demonstrate your passion for driving client service excellence, ensuring that the agency is delivering high quality work that delivers real business results for your clients (proving strong ROI). 
As an expert in your client’s business, you will monitor and review the quality of all work that is created to ensure that you’re happy that it meets the strategic goals of your clients and deliver on their expectations / SOW. 
Identify challenges within the client business and recommend solutions to solve these, driving additional revenue growth for your clients.

 Client Onboarding & Project Management 

Working alongside your Group Account Director and Account Director create Scope of Work documents for new client projects. 
Help to onboard clients following signed contracts to ensure they have the best service experience with Mediablaze. 
Create detailed delivery timelines in gantt chart format to ensure that all work is delivered in-line with client expectations, ensuring they have full transparency at all times. 
Educate clients on standard operating procedures, ensuring that a collaborative relationship is built from the beginning.
 Demonstrate a high degree of project management expertise, working with multi discipline practitioners within the studio to ensure all work is being delivered on time and on budget. 
Ensure that all internal resources are planned accordingly in-line with your delivery timelines. 
Work with delivery teams to ensure that projects are running smoothly, ensuring that they understand the client's ambitions and that the client understands the requirements of the team to meet them.

 Administrative Responsibilities

 Ensure your clients receive contact reports after each engagement, outlining key discussion and action point. 
Ensure that all project and retainer work is budgeted and planned within the agencies finance and resourcing software. 
Ensure that all 3rd party costs are planned accordingly in-line with your delivery timelines, and each supplier has a PO allocated to them. 
Ensure that all agency time (including your own) is being tracked correctly and in line with agency procedure.
 Ensure accurate time reports are supplied to your clients on a monthly basis. 
Ensure that all files and documentation are properly maintained, and provide easy access to information for clients and agency teams as needed. 
Ensure that all contractors and freelancers have signed relevant contracts with the agency. 
Ensure that all booked revenue and pipeline opportunities are captured accurately and in line with agency process.

 Advocacy & New Business 
As an Account Manager at Mediablaze, you will...

 Speak with authority and passion to clients, and become a powerful advocate for Mediablaze’s service offering and why our pillars of content, platforms and performance are critical to driving business results.
 Present the agency’s full offering with confidence in front of clients. 
Run and manage client presentations as necessary. 
Keep abreast of developments in the world of digital marketing. 
Monitor the emergence of new platforms and technologies and how these deliver on the every changing demands of the CMO.

 Requirements

 2+ years digital agency experience. 
Gravitas and instant credibility internally and externally. 
Proven track record working with key clients within the digital marketing space. 
Experience of managing content, digital and/or performance projects. 
Proven track record of presenting to client decision makers. 
Proven track record of building relationships, meeting and exceeding client needs. 
An understanding of business and client strategy. 
A desire to work in a close knit, highly successful team with clear accountability. 
Ability to thrive in a fluid and fast-paced environment with excellent organisational skills. 
Bags of energy, dedication, commercial acumen, entrepreneurial drive and creative flair. 
Motivated, self-starters need only apply. Mediablaze is a fast paced and challenging organisation. You must not wait for solutions; the expectation is that you deliver them.



 How to apply
 To start the conversation and for us to hear about you and what you’re looking for in your next role, please share your CV to: spike.bowen@mediablaze.com

DNO Framework contracts and product approvals are critical for other parts of the business, specifically the Industrial Market where the customers require DNO approved product for much of their connection business.
 


 The DNO Team is one of three main segment teams making up the overall LEUK Sales Team – the other two being the Industrial Team and the Export Team. All three Teams are supported by the Tendering Team and have a designated Tendering Engineer assigned to them.

   1. The role will be field/ home based with regular visits to Lucy offices and customers in the UK. Travel to overseas locations will occasionally be required.
 

   2. The Employee’s home base must be located on the UK mainland, ideally within the SPEN, NPG licensed area.

description:
Job Description:
 

   Tucasi have been providing innovative software to the Education sector for the last 10 years. Our Company was formed to address the problems of the income collection process in schools and we now have over 2,500 schools across 145 Local Authorities Nationwide, using our systems. 500,000 parents are also registered to pay online using our secure online payment system.
 


   We have combined knowledge of School Governance with technical expertise and have created an organisation that is entirely focused on helping schools.
 


   We listen to schools to find out what they want from us and we also understand that software products must be backed up by good service. We invest significant resources in creating a team that focuses not only on selling the system but also training schools, supporting them and making time to listen to what they have to say.
 


   Working for Tucasi:
 



     We are a growing, enthusiastic company that employs talented individuals with interesting backgrounds, this makes for a happy and co-operative working environment
   


     Many of our employees are long serving which gives you the opportunity to learn extensively from colleagues with considerable experience
   


     Our product range makes life easier for our customers, so they are enthusiastic and excited to work with us
   


     We are a close team and we try to share our success with our employees. We have regular social functions and encourage teams to work together
   


     We expect your commitment but will respect your desire to balance home and work lives.
   



   POSITION:
 


   The National Account Manager will be a vital part of the sales team responsible for selling our Software and Services, and reports to the Head of Sales. It will be the NAM's role to work with the sales team to ensure that all agreed sales targets are met, or exceeded by providing a consistent supply of leads.
 

   The NAM will generate qualified new business for the sales team through a combination of cold calling, conducting sales campaigns by working with the marketing team to support social campaigns and complement other communication streams and networking with contacts in the industry.
 

   This role would suit a self-motivated individual that can harvest relationships quickly through persistent and targeted communication, selling into the Education industry experience is an advantage but not a requirement. We seek a candidate with an exceptional ability to think strategically and communicate effectively, focusing on overall customer satisfaction and maintaining long term relationships that generate quality business.
 


   JOB RESPONSIBILITIES:
 


   Reporting to the Head of Sales responsibilities will include:
 



     Conduct and manage the sales cycle process from initial contact through to qualification by actively listening and building trust with prospects and understanding their needs
   


     Carry out effective product demonstrations to customers and prospects
   


     Lead negotiations, coordinate complex decision-making processes and overcome objections in order to maximize opportunities to achieve group sales
   


     Maintain an in-depth knowledge of the Company’s product portfolio and awareness of competitor products.
   


     Support the drafting of compelling tender submissions and proposals
   


     Learn, adopt and adhere to the company sales guidelines and standard operating procedures (SOPs). This includes maintaining and developing the Company’s CRM database in accordance with company standards and developing accurate, high quality and professional sales documentation and correspondence templates.
   


     Devise and implement lead generation activities, as required. Qualify, develop and manage a lead through to sales conversion, whether sourced or provided by Companies. Respond to and follow up all sales enquiries using appropriate methods as per the SOP.
   


     Develop and maintain a sales pipeline of sufficient size to achieve agreed sales targets.
   


     Ensure all monthly sales targets (KPIs) set by management and agreed on in advance are met or exceeded. This will necessitate some or all of the following activities:
   



       Identifying the needs and wants of a potential customer.
     


       Presenting the Company solution without misrepresentation.
     


       Handling objections from potential sales opportunities.
     


       Fulfilling reporting requirements to the Sales Manager according to the deadlines set for the Department.
     


       Provide excellent customer services to clients over the phone or in person.
     



     Attend training to develop relevant knowledge, techniques and skills.
   


     Establish and maintain strategic relationships, alliances and networks within industry (or any other vertical market) as well as with other key stakeholders to generate sales leads.
   


     Perform any other duties related to the promotion, sales and delivery of the products, as directed by the management team from time to time.
   



   JOB QUALIFICATIONS:
 



     Proven experience selling software solutions.
   


     Relevant professional sales training and experience.
   


     Excellent written, verbal and presentation communications skills.
   


     The ability to build and foster business relationships.
   


     Good understanding of technology.
   


     A good degree of computer literacy and technical competency.
   


     Selling into the Education sector is an advantage.
   



   Your personal characteristics will include:
 



     High degree of self-motivation.
   


     Energy and enthusiasm.
   


     Honesty and integrity.
   


     Strong customer service mindset.
   


     Goal orientation.
   


     Professionalism and persistence with ability to overcome obstacles and setbacks.
